unnormalised: Okay, so someone asked about travelling through Indian roadways, right? Let me tell you about my experience driving from Bangalore to Chennai last month. I started at 6:00 AM sharp to avoid the city traffic. The NH44 is mostly good, but you'll find some patches that are a bit rough, especially after Krishnagiri.
normalised: Okay, so someone asked about travelling through Indian roadways, right? Let me tell you about my experience driving from Bangalore to Chennai last month. I started at six zero zero A-M sharp to avoid the city traffic. The N-H fourty four is mostly good, but you'll find some patches that are a bit rough, especially after Krishnagiri.

unnormalised: We took a break around 9:30 AM for some idli and coffee. After that, it was smooth sailing. I used Google Maps, and it showed an estimated time of arrival of 1:30 PM, but we got delayed because of a tyre puncture near Vellore. Had to call a mechanic, cost me â‚¹800.
normalised: We took a break around nine thirty A-M for some idli and coffee. After that, it was smooth sailing. I used Google Maps, and it showed an estimated time of arrival of one thirty P-M, but we got delayed because of a tyre puncture near Vellore. Had to call a mechanic, cost me rupee eight hundred.

unnormalised: Finally reached Chennai around 3:00 PM. The total distance, according to my car's odometer, was 345 km. Overall, it was a decent drive, but next time, I might just prepone the trip or take the train. Less hassle that way, you know?
normalised: Finally reached Chennai around three zero zero P-M. The total distance, according to my car's odometer, was three hundred and forty five kilometer. Overall, it was a decent drive, but next time, I might just prepone the trip or take the train. Less hassle that way, you know?
